title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 381.3 - Withdrawal and refund of co-esc contributions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 381.3 - Withdrawal and refund of co-esc contributions

State Regulations

In the event of termination of employment other than as a
result of transfer to another public employer, a member participating in the
retirement plan provided for in article 22 of the Retirement and Social

Security Law, who is not vested or entitled to any other benefit under article
22, may withdraw his CO-ESC contributions and terminate his membership in the

New York State and Local Police and Fire Retirement System by filing a form
prescribed by the retirement system for this purpose. Such a request may be
made after the member has been separated from service for at least 15 days. The
retirement system shall thereupon refund the CO-ESC
contributions. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
381.3

Adopted, New

York State Register January 29, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 4, eff. 1/29/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
